title: Authors and Citation
text: Gildea (2022). dukecvd: Makes color blind friendly visualizations Duke's official colors. https://github.com/aidangildea/dukecvd, https://aidangildea.github.io/dukecvd/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dukecvd: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors},   author = {Aidan Gildea},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/aidangildea/dukecvd, https://aidangildea.github.io/dukecvd/}, }

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
text: goal dukecvd generate visualizations Duke’s official suite colors color blind friendly way. package integrated ggplot2 visualization tools.

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
code: # Install dukecvd directly: install.packages("dukecvd")  # Or alternatively, install development version from GitHub # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("aidangildea/dukecvd")

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
text: package fully integrated ggplot2, therefore, allows customize several visualization features. adding aesthetic functions theme_duke() scale_color_duke() visualizations, can easily implement Duke official colors color blind friendly way. information use ggplot2, please visit GitHub repository.

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
text: First, create standard ggplot2 visualization. example, use scatter plot.  , simply convert visualization Duke official colors calling theme_duke().
code: library(ggplot2) library(dukecvd) plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width)) +   ggplot2::geom_point(ggplot2::aes(colour = Species)) +   ggplot2::labs(title = "Title", caption = "Caption", x = "X Var", y = "Y Var")  plot plot + theme_duke()

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
text: questions package use, please reach Aidan Gildea aidan.gildea@duke.edu.

title: Theme Duke — theme_duke
code: theme_duke(   base_size = 11,   base_family = "",   base_line_size = base_size/22,   base_rect_size = base_size/22 )

title: Theme Duke — theme_duke
text: base_size base size base_family base family base_line_size baseline size base_rect_size base rect

title: Theme Duke — theme_duke
code: plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(cars, ggplot2::aes(speed, dist)) + ggplot2::geom_point() + ggplot2::labs(title = "Duke Blue") plot + theme_duke() #> [1] "Garamond 3 LT needs to be downloaded to your system." #> [1] "EB Garamond needs to be downloaded to your system." #> [1] "OpenSans needs to be downloaded to your system." #> [1] "Atkinson-Hyperlegible needs to be downloaded to your system." #> Warning: Garamond 3 LT Std needs to be downloaded to your system. #> Warning: EB Garamond needs to be downloaded to your system. #> Warning: Open Sans needs to be downloaded to your system. #> Warning: Atkinson-Hyperlegible needs to be downloaded to your system.
